name: Glenelg Competitive Programming Team
headerTaglineTwo: We're the Glenelg High School Competitive Programming Team

projects.title: Join the club!
projects.description: Interested Glenelg High School students, fill out the Google Form linked to the image!

projects.title: Click here to view the recap video for Hack the Colosseum!
projects.description: Photos are available on the Howard County Library System Flickr page. The video is released on our YouTube Channel.

projects.title: Just wrapped up Hack the Colosseum!
projects.description: After a year from the first hackathon with 150+ participants, 30+ volunteers, and 40+ projects submitted and thanks to the partnership of Howard County Library System, our sponsors for their generous support, our volunteers for their hard work, and all of the participants. We are now excited to announce that Hack the Colosseum 2025 will be held on November 20, 2025. Check out our website by clicking on the image! We can't wait to see you all there!

projects.title: Interested middle schoolers, attend our summer camp!
projects.description: Free beginner coding classes at the Glenwood Library on Saturdays.  Click the image for more information.

projects.title: First place at Lockheed Martin CodeQuest!
projects.description: Congratulations Kevin Hwang (center left), Samuel Yoon (left), and Alex Chen (right) on winning 1st place in the Advanced Division at Lockheed Martin's CodeQuest Competition in 2023. In 2024, congratulations to Abhi Kannan, Jack Zhang, and Shreyash Gajam for winning 2nd place in the Advanced Division at Lockheed Martin's CodeQuest Competition! (Unfortunately, no photo was provided for the 2024 team)

projects.title: Need help programming?
projects.description: Need help in your programming classes? We're here to help! We provide free programming tutoring from Glenelg's top computer science students. Click the image to contact us!

aboutpara: The Glenelg Competitive Programming Team is a coding organization founded by and for high school students interested in competitive programming fiscally sponsored by the Hack Club Foundation which is a 501(c)(3) organization. We have competed and placed first in prestigious competitions such as Lockheed Martin CodeQuest. Our mission is not just to code well, but more importantly to have fun while doing so.
